Message.Title: ZTE U988S With 1.8GHz Tegra 4i Processor and Android 4.2.2 Gets Benchmarked
Message.Msg: Antutu score: 29784 Amazing! Folks, pleased be reminded that Tegra 4i's top clock speed is 2.3 GHz, and this test was run at 500 MHz below! And Tegra 4i is based on Cortex A9 plus 60 gpu cores. Other features of ZTE 099S: --4.2.2. Android (most advanced version) --5.7 in 720p display --2 GB RAM --8 MP rear/2 MP front cameras --Bluetooth, MicroSD, GPS, Micro USB --Cheap and possibly coming out earlier than Q1 2014 SOURCE: Talkandroid (please google the title subject to access the original article)

Message.Title: Nvidia's Strategy is Falling Apart
Message.Msg: 1. Intel is DISPLACING Nvidia in more and more GPU sockets thatnks to help from Nvidia. Intel is using licensed Nvidia IP to kick Nvidia out of more thin and light notebook designs where a single combined CPU+GPU saves power. 2. Nvidia aware that the APU would eventually erode GPU share looked to Tegra for revenue growth. Qualcomm is shutting Tegra down and DISPLACING Tegra at Google and, as has been reported, will soon replace Tegra in the NEW Microsoft Surface RT. That Nexus business accounted 60% of Tegra revenue according to Digitimes. Tegra 4 is DOA and Nvidia licensed IP to Intel is kicking Nvidia's out of notebooks. Nvidia bet on Tegra for future growth and then along came Qualcomm. In the far corner we have the heavy weight Qualcomm weighing in at $106 BILLION In the near corner we have the heavy weight Intel weighing in at $123 BILLION and squeezed in the middle we have Nvidia weighing in at $8 BIILLION and trying to take them both on. lol You know how this fight will end don't you Nvidia fans? The Nvidia strategy is falling apart. IMHO

Message.Title: Nvidia kicked OUT of Xbox, OUT of PS, OUT of MacBook AIr, OUT of Mac Pro, OUT of Nexus 7.
Message.Msg: At one time Nvidia won the first Xbox, the PS3, the MacBook Air, the Mac Pro and Nexus 7 And then Microsoft, Sony, Apple and Google found a better solution that did not include Nvidia. The NEW Xbox One, PS4, NEW MacBook Air, NEW Mac Pro Desktop and the Next Nexus 7 all have no need for an Nvidia anything. And no amount of Nvidia cheer leading or bashing the competition posted on a message board here can make up for LOSING HIGH PROFILE BUSINESS from technologies brightest and best outfits. Why did all these marquee products DUMP Nvidia? IMHO

Message.Title: "How AMD’s hardware in next-gen consoles will affect PC gamers"
Message.Msg: "How AMD’s hardware in next-gen consoles will affect PC gamers" "We’ve known AMD are the go-to guys for next-gen console silicon for a good while now. The tech press has been speculating since the consoles’ specs were first announced as to how the PC could benefit from Sony and Microsoft opting for the x86, and specifically AMD, architecture. After all the Xbox 360 was running AMD graphics hardware and, from my perspective, the benefits to the PC from that relationship are pretty intangible at best. There are signs that things may be different this time around. “The consoles are really the target for a lot of the game developers, if it’s a Radeon heart powering that console, like the PS4 or Xbox 360, that means these games devs are going to be designing their games, designing their features and really optimising for that Radeon heart” said AMD’s Devon Nekechuk around the launch of the Radeon HD 7990. But why, specifically, will that be the case? I asked AMD’s worldwide manager of ISV gaming engineering, Nicolas Thibieroz for the nitty gritty. “We paid a lot of attention to the DirectCompute processing capabilities in the GCN architecture because we know that this can enable all kinds of features, from physics simulations to advanced lighting schemes. Now those capabilities are going to be the baseline development platform for a lot more developers and we know that this is an area developers will explore more and more.” That’s potentially good news for the minority of gamers running GCN-based graphics cards in their PC, but what about the larger percentage of folk running Nvidia-based GPUs? The Kepler generation spent much of its silicon focusing on traditional rendering power, eschewing the compute-focus they had with the Fermi architecture. In terms of DirectCompute power then the GCN cards are a good bit quicker. Given that devs are likely to be looking at the GPU in the next-gen consoles for more general purpose computing, " source: pcgamer

Topic.Title: ZTE U988S With 1.8GHz Tegra 4i Processor and Android 4.2.2 Gets Benchmarked

Message.Msg: 1. 5.7", that's not a phone, that's a phablet. And you would look silly holding that up to your ears. 2. 720p only? that's nothing for a 5.7" screen 3. 8MP rear camera - really does not make much use of the T3i. 4. 'cheap'? everything depends on the $. Until they put a price on it, it's all speculation and nobody can speculate on how it will do. Motorola Zoom and WinRT shinny examples. Q1 '14 - no Nexus 7, Tegra sales already well below $100M/Q (after you strip off the 'cheap' modem $s, I think longs can count themselves to be lucky if Tegra is doing $50M/Q). Haswell finally able to strip off higher end notebook graphic sales. The consoles are selling like no tomorrow, contrary to what the pumpers here would like to see. For the rest of the year, especially in the X'mas stockings, 'the pain, the pain'. Remember, Intel's stuffed envelopes ending right around the corner.

Message.Title: TSMC shares downgraded on lower Samsung S4 sales forecast
Message.Msg: TSMC shares downgraded on lower Samsung S4 sales forecast In a recent report, Morgan Stanley reduced its estimates for shipments of the Samsung Galaxy S4 smartphone from 24 million units to 21 million in the second quarter and from 27 million units to 22 million in the third quarter, citing a decline in component orders. While the Galaxy S4 phone uses a chipset from Qualcomm Inc., which is one of TSMC's clients, the brokerage firm predicted that every 5 million cut to the Galaxy S4 shipment estimates will translate to around 1 percent revenue shortfall for TSMC. SOURCE: FocusTaiwan Tw ___ However, the possible release of a higher version of S4, deploying Snapdragon S800, may only partially offset the reduced shipment of the S600 powered S4.

Topic.Title: Nvidia kicked OUT of Xbox, OUT of PS, OUT of MacBook AIr, OUT of Mac Pro, OUT of Nexus 7.

Message.Msg: "At one time Nvidia won the first Xbox, the PS3, the MacBook Air, the Mac Pro and Nexus 7" Nvidia and Nvidia fans have been bashing the Xbox One and the PS4 lately but when Nvidia had that high profile business you didn't see that BS about a GPU card and PCs, low margins, and consoles going away. Nvidia has no class, unlike IBM whose CPUs also didn't make it into the NEW Xbox One or the PS4 hasn't said a word to denigrate the Xbox One, the PS4, Microsoft or Sony. Nvidia lies, they claimed Game Console vendors weren't offering enough to make it worth their while right? Worth their while for what? Nvidia does not have a 64 bit CPU, even the old consoles are 64 bit. And how would they know what was offered if they didn't try to sell them something first. Nvidia can not claim they don't want that business after being rejected and Nvidia was rejected regardless how they try to spin that rejection. Nvidia is not in the Xbox One, PS4, NEW MacBook Air, NEW Mac Pro Desktop and the Next Nexus 7 because Microsoft, Sony, Apple and Google didn't want Nvidia in those products NOT because of some BS Nvidiia claims. Nvidia don't get a say about how those tech giants design their products. IMHO

When Nvidia licensed GPU IP to Intel they bet big on Tegra for future growth but Qualcomm is stepping on that Tegra growth like a bug everywhere it pops up. Qualcomm squashed Tegra over at Google. The Next Nexus 7 will be packing a Qualcomm part. And Qualcomm has reportedly squahed Tegra over at Microsoft, reports claim the NEW Surface RT will be packing a Qualcomm part as well. You Nvidia fans can call the NEW Sufface RT reports rumors if it helps you sleep at night, just like you called the Next Nexus 7 reports rumors. But you ain't calling Qualcomm is in the Next Nexus 7 a rumor now are you? Qualcomm is putting the run on Tegra. Tegra 4 is DOA IMHO

Message.Title: "Three for three: How AMD won the war for the heart of next-gen consoles"
Message.Msg: "Three for three: How AMD won the war for the heart of next-gen consoles" "The era of speculation is over. We now know the details of all new next-gen consoles. Post-E3 2013, all of the major players have revealed the platforms, the games and the hardware that will power console gaming for the next several years. Sitting at the heart of the consoles are three related cores built with AMD technology. The company went three for three. This was no accident. According to representatives from AMD that Polygon spoke with during E3 2013, this was the result of a multi-year, companywide effort. In our conversations, we learned how AMD did it, how the company wants to help developers make better games and how it's trying to define the future of gaming. ..." source: polygon
